jobDescription: Description: The Criminal Investigative Division (CID) is seeking administrative, analysis and data entry support. Duties:Provides support on issues relating to a wide range of administrative, office management and program related matters that impact the organizational workforce, office documentation, and record keeping.Responsible to the organization's principle official for ensuring system report management to include uploading approved reports into and between databases, maintenance matters related to the databases, compliance related to the task force documentation management and sharing, dissemination, and other associated documentation functions.Provide support to the FBI intelligence programs, Subject Matter Experts (SMEs), and programmatic partners, as directed.Assists with the preparation of final reports to include editing for errors, ensuring proper dissemination, as well as provide support in the creation of charts, graphs and computer based presentations.Maintaining and keeping task force technology interactive (Share Point) portals with current content and phone lists.Establish and maintain liaison with task force members, outside entities and stake holders.Establish and maintain protocols and effective methods for tracking task force statistics and accomplishments.Establish and maintain protocols and functions related to tracking property purchased (inventory) and supplies for the task force.Assists with the preparation and dissemination of intelligence reports.Perform a variety of highly complex administrative and office analysis functions to identify inefficiencies; streamline processes; eliminate redundancies; evaluate performance measures; and ensure processes meet valid requirements.Other functions and special assignments, as required.Qualifications:Four-year bachelor’s degree from an accredited university; the education requirement may be substituted with 8 years of experience (in addition to the 5 to 7 year minimum experience requirement.5 to 7 years’ experience in the administrative/management analysis field; office administration, data input, and/or records maintenance experience.Experience with a wide variety of information systems, to include federal, state and local law enforcement and intelligence databases, commercial software and public source systems: Preference for familiarity with FBI databases, portals or other operating systems, highly desirable and critical.Preference for familiarity with any Department of Corrections (DOCs) portals or other operating systems, highly desirable and critical.Experience handling sensitive intelligence within the intelligence community (IC), to include IC product production, handling and dissemination.Experience using various computer software programs (Microsoft Office products to include Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access) and databases; preference for experience with FBI, BOP, DOCs, Sheriff’s Office (jail) databases.Experience establishing, organizing, and maintaining electronic and manual files.Experience in synthesizing vast amounts of data to derive meaningful actionable or informative intelligence products to the IC, to include strong written and oral communication skills.Experience in interagency liaison and working in a task force environment.Strong presentation skills, to include producing written reports, providing oral briefings and developing support materials such as charts, PowerPoint presentations, and other handouts/pamphlets.Experience in working with multiple agencies in a task force environment while using intelligence to identify subjects, associates, methods of operations, communications, and deconfliction of investigative or analytical efforts.Knowledge and experience related to gangs/security threat groups (STG) within correctional institutions and its operations, protocols, and structure, highly desirable: Preference for familiarity with any DOC administration operating procedures and policies, highly desirable and critical.Successfully working in a constantly changing environment and adapting to the shift of work priorities and direction.
